dc:description:
The *ZMYND10* gene was first reported in relation to primary ciliary dyskinesia in 2013 (Zariwala et al., PMID: 23891469, Moore et al., PMID: 23891471). The specific disease entity, primary ciliary dyskinesia 22 (MONDO:0014192, OMIM #615444), is one of at least 45 different primary ciliary dyskinesias (PCD) distinguished by a single monogenic cause. Affected patients can have onset of symptoms at birth and reported cases have been diagnosed with PCD either in infancy or in childhood. Frequent features among reported patients are chronic wet cough from early childhood, neonatal respiratory distress, sinusitis, otitis media, bronchiectasis, and decreased nasal nitric oxide. Approximately 50% of cases exhibit situs inversus or heterotaxy. Cilia are largely or completely immotile. Adult patients can exhibit decreased fertility. Biopsies of the airway epithelium show ciliary ultrastructure with absent or abnormal outer and inner dynein arms, although one reported case with a PCD-associated phenotype and homozygous missense variant has been found to exhibit normal ciliary ultrastructure (PMID: 23891469, and personal communication with the authors). This finding emphasizes the clear need for additional case reports to establish the full extent of outer and inner dynein arm defects in *ZMYND10*-related disease.

This curation has scored eleven suspected deleterious *ZMYND10* variants (two missense, six frameshift, and three nonsense), which were collectively reported in twelve probands in three publications (PMID: 23891471, PMID: 23891469, PMID: 26139845). All of the probands harbored biallelic variants confirmed to be present in trans. Nine probands harbored variants in the homozygous state, four of whom were reported to be from consanguineous parents. Three others probands harbored *ZMYND10* variants in the compound heterozygous state. The molecular mechanism appears to be biallelic loss-of-function with an autosomal recessive mode of inheritance, characterized in at least some cases by variants predicted to trigger the absence of a gene product. More genetic evidence was available (PMID: 26824761) but was not included as the maximum for this category of evidence had already been reached. Large families with segregation data were not found for inclusion in this gene curation. Please note that the genetic evidence scored in this curation has relied heavily on the best-characterized *ZMYND10* variants from the literature, while an urgent need remains for additional published data to evaluate the pathogenicity of many other emerging variants.

This gene-disease relationship is also supported by experimental evidence that high levels of *ZMYND10* expression in humans (PMID: 23715323) and mice (PMID: 23891471) are specific to tissues known to harbor multi-ciliated cells. *ZMYND10* expression also increases dramatically when cultured human bronchial epithelial cells are subjected to conditions that stimulate ciliogenesis (PMID: 17413031). Biochemical studies indicate that the ZMYND10 protein interacts with the chaperone molecules FKBP8 and HSP90, functioning as a required chaperone during cytoplasmic pre-assembly of dyneins (PMID: 29916806). Animal models lacking Zmynd10 exhibit destabilization of dynein arm components (PMID: 29916806). ZMYND10 also physically interacts with the protein product of the LRRC6 / DNAAF11 gene, which harbors variants known to cause another form of PCD (PMID: 23891471). *Drosophila*, zebrafish, and medaka models with biallelic silencing or deletion of the respective genes orthologous to *ZMYND10* recapitulate cellular and organ-level features of the human disease state (PMID: 23891469, PMID: 23891471, PMID: 28823919). Mouse models in particular exhibit absent outer and inner dynein arms, situs inversus totalis, mucopurulent nasal plugs, and reduced motility of cilia and sperm (PMID: 29916806). Rescue experiments have demonstrated the potential of a wild-type transgene from *Drosophila*, medaka, or mouse to rescue phenotypes of endogenous *Zmynd10* disruption in various model organisms (PMID: 28823919, PMID: 23891471). 

In summary, *ZMYND10* is definitively associated with primary ciliary dyskinesia 22. This has been repeatedly demonstrated in both research and diagnostic settings, and has been upheld over time without the emergence of contradictory evidence, leading to a Definitive classification. This classification was approved by the ClinGen Motile Ciliopathy GCEP on February 7th, 2022 (SOP Version 9).

evidence.dc:description: The model is a match to the human patients at both the cellular level (ciliary and flagellar morphology) and the organismal level (heterotaxy) but has been down-scored for the inability of the organism to model the respiratory phenotypes.

Morpholino-treated or TALEN-based knockout animals lacking zmynd10 resembled human patients in that they exhibited left-right symmetry randomization (Fig. 3), abnormal ciliary swelling (Fig. 4), outer dynein arm absence (Fig. 4C, 4D), and immotile flagella (Videos 3, 4). Additional related features were scoliosis (Figs. 2C, 6B) and polycystic kidney (Figs. 2H, 2I).
evidence.rdfs:label: zmynd10 knockdown in medaka

evidence.dc:description: The model recapitulates cellular features of the human patient phenotypes, but has been down-scored since organ-level phenotypes are not applicable.

Animals with P-element-based silencing of Zmynd10 resembled human patients in that they exhibited inner and outer dynein arm absence (Figures 3H, 3I) and male infertility (Figures 4A and 4B, with absence of sperm). An additional potentially consistent feature was impaired proprioception (Figure 3A).
evidence.rdfs:label: Zmynd10 silencing in Drosophila

evidence.dc:description: The model recapitulates both cellular and organ-level phenotypes of the human patients, including one of the respiratory features, and so is considered strong evidence supporting the relationship of Zmynd10 loss-of-function to PCD.

CRISPR-based knockout animals lacking Zmynd10 resembled human patients in that they exhibited hydrocephalus (Figures 1E, 1S2E), Absent outer and inner dynein arms by TEM (Figure 1F), Situs inversus totalis (Figures 1G, 1S2F), Abnormal nasal mucus secretion, specifically the presence of mucopurulent plugs in nasal turbinates (Figure 1H), Reduced sperm motility (Figure 1S2C, Video 6), Decreased testicular size (Figure 1S2A), Absence of gross ciliary or cytoskeletal defects (Figure 1S3), Immotile cilia (Videos 2, 4), and destabilization of the dynein proteins DNAH5, DNAH9, DNAI1, and DNAI2 in the trachea and oviduct (Figures 2A, 2B).
evidence.rdfs:label: CRISPR-based deletion of Zmynd10 in mice

evidence.dc:description: These data support the hypothesis that ZMYND10 performs a chaperone function during cytoplasmic pre-assembly of dyneins.

Interaction with the immunophilin FKBP8 and the chaperone HSP90 is consistent with the hypothesis that ZMYND10 acts as a required chaperone during cytoplasmic pre-assembly of dyneins, and is consistent with the destabilization of dynein arm components in animal models lacking Zmynd10 (PMID: 29916806, Figure 2).
evidence.rdfs:label: ZMYND10 interacts with cytoplasmic chaperone proteins.

evidence.dc:description: This evidence of interaction with a PCD-associated gene product is considered supportive of ZMYND10 as a potential PCD-related gene product.

Yeast-2-hybrid was used to establish the interaction (Figure 4F), with positive results regardless of which protein was used for bait vs. prey. GST pulldown of ZMYND10 was also used to show that Myc-tagged LRRC6 was pulled down successfully (Figure S7). LRRC6 (also known as DNAAF11) has been implicated in primary ciliary dyskinesia 19.
evidence.rdfs:label: Protein-protein interaction of Zmynd10 with Lrrc6

evidence.dc:description: This evidence supports a role of ZMYND10 in motile cilia, specifically within the lung epithelium. Scoring is conservative since evidence of this category has already been scored.
The expression of ZMYND10 mRNA in cultured human bronchial epithelial cells increases by 14X during air-liquid interface culture, which is known to stimulate ciliogenesis (Table 1).
evidence.rdfs:label: Bronchial ZMYND10 expression increases during ciliogenesis.

evidence.dc:description: The expression profile of ZMYND10 across multiple human tissues shows high expression in several tissues that contain multi-ciliated cells, consistent of a role in ciliary function and PCD. Mouse data are consistent.

Human RNA-seq data from the GTEx portal (PMID: 23715323) show high ZMYND10 expression in testis, fallopian tube, and lung. All of these tissues contain multi-ciliated or flagellated cells, consistent with a role for ZMYND10 in ciliary function. These data have been confirmed and complemented in a separate publication by an in situ hybridization experiment in mouse embryos showing Zmynd10 expression specifically in the ciliated epithelial layer linked to nasal and lung epithelium (Figure 2 in PMID: 23891471).
evidence.rdfs:label: ZMYND10 is highly expressed in multi-ciliated tissues

evidence.dc:description: NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.486dup (p.Ser163IlefsTer20) is a frameshift variant in exon 5 of 12 and is predicted to trigger nonsense-mediated decay or at least to truncate ~63% of the protein product. The variant has been down-scored due to the known consanguinity of the family and the limitations of the genotyping method.

evidence.rdfs:label: Zariwala_2013_Patient_OP-1366_II1
evidence.detectionMethod: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone, and was performed by next-generation sequencing-based re-sequencing of the 12 exons of ZMYND10.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The individual has been diagnosed with PCD prior to genotyping. Other phenotypes that contributed to this diagnosis are not included in the report. Although TEM results are not available, defects in both DNAH5 (ODA) and DNALI1 (IDA) localization have been observed by immunofluorescence.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone.

evidence.dc:description: NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.1096C>T (p.Gln366Ter) is a nonsense variant in exon 10 of 12 and is predicted to trigger nonsense-mediated decay or at least to truncate ~17% of the protein product. Down-scoring has been performed due to the homozygous state and the limitations of the genotyping method.

evidence.rdfs:label: Zariwala_2013_Patient_A5014_398
evidence.detectionMethod: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone, and was performed by next-generation sequencing-based re-sequencing of the 12 exons of ZMYND10.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The individual has been diagnosed with PCD prior to genotyping. Outer dynein arm defects reportedly affect both ODA and IDA. Other phenotypes that contributed to this diagnosis are not included in the report.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone.

evidence.dc:description: NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.1038_1039del (p.Gly347GlnfsTer?) is a frameshift variant in exon 10 of 12 and is predicted to trigger nonsense-mediated decay or at least to truncate ~21% of the protein product. Down-scoring has been performed due to the homozygous state and the limitations of the genotyping method.

evidence.rdfs:label: Zariwala_2013_Patient_DCP841
evidence.detectionMethod: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone, and was performed by next-generation sequencing-based re-sequencing of the 12 exons of ZMYND10.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The individual has been diagnosed with PCD prior to genotyping. Outer dynein arm defects reportedly affect both ODA and IDA. Other phenotypes that contributed to this diagnosis are not included in the report.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone.

evidence.dc:description: NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.683G>A (p.Trp228Ter) is a frameshift variant in exon 7 of 12 and is predicted to trigger nonsense-mediated decay or at least to truncate ~48% of the protein product. The variant has been down-scored due to the homozygous state and the limitations of the genotyping method.

evidence.rdfs:label: Zariwala_2013_Patient_OP-1
evidence.detectionMethod: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone, and was performed by next-generation sequencing-based re-sequencing of the 12 exons of ZMYND10.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The individual has been diagnosed with PCD prior to genotyping. Absent/shortened dynein arms affect both ODA and IDA. Other phenotypes that contributed to this diagnosis are not included in the report.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone.

evidence.dc:description: NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.608_609dup (p.Thr205AlafsTer3) is a frameshift variant in exon 6 of 12 and is predicted to trigger nonsense-mediated decay or at least to truncate ~54% of the protein product. Down-scoring has been performed due to the known consanguinity of the family and the limitations of the genotyping method.

evidence.rdfs:label: Zariwala_2013_Patient_OP-143_II1
evidence.detectionMethod: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone, and was performed by next-generation sequencing-based re-sequencing of the 12 exons of ZMYND10.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The individual has been diagnosed with PCD prior to genotyping. Other phenotypes that contributed to this diagnosis are not included in the report. TEM results are described as showing ODA and IDA defects, and which have been confirmed by localization have been observed through defects in DNAH5 and DNALI1 immunofluorescence.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone.

evidence.dc:description: Despite the abundance of functional characterization, the variant has been up-scored conservatively due to the mild / hypomorphic effect and the known origin of the patient in a genetically isolated group.

NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.47T>G (p.Val16Gly) is a missense variant that appears to be a hypomorphic allele, correlating with a milder / intermediate phenotype in the patient and similar ciliary motility defects in a Drosophila model. Rescue evidence indicates that it only partially rescues the sterility phenotype of the flies, relative to the wild-type.

evidence.rdfs:label: Moore_2013_Patient_UCL-142_II:1
evidence.detectionMethod: DNA from the proband was subjected to whole-exome sequencing, followed by candidate gene Sanger resequencing.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The patient has been noted to have a possibly intermediate phenotype is nasal respiratory cilia, as well as variable retention of inner and outer dynein arms in various axonemal cross-sections. Motile cilia are described as having a stiff and slowed beat.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: DNA from the proband was subjected to whole-exome sequencing.

evidence.dc:description: NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.967C>T (p.Gln323Ter) is a frameshift variant in exon 9 of 12 and is predicted to trigger nonsense-mediated decay or at least to truncate ~27% of the protein product. The variant has been down-scored due to the homozygous state and the limitations of the genotyping method.

evidence.rdfs:label: Zariwala_2013_Patient_A5014-274_#383
evidence.detectionMethod: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone, and was performed by next-generation sequencing-based re-sequencing of the 12 exons of ZMYND10.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The individual has been diagnosed with PCD prior to genotyping. Other phenotypes that contributed to this diagnosis are not included in the report. While TEM results show ODA and IDA defects, localization data by immunofluorescence are absent.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone.

evidence.dc:description: NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.1136A>G (p.Tyr379Cys) is a missense variant that does not have evidence of a defect in protein function. It has been down-scored for the lack of phenotypic match.

evidence.rdfs:label: Zariwala_2013_Patient_A4231_#568
evidence.detectionMethod: Homozygosity mapping was performed to identify 13 candidate regions, followed by whole-exome resequencing (WER). Sanger sequencing is likely to have been performed for confirmation, although it is not described.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Homozygosity mapping was performed to identify 13 candidate regions, followed by whole-exome resequencing (WER).

evidence.dc:description: NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.65del (p.Phe22SerfsTer21) is a frameshift variant in exon 1 of 12 and is predicted to trigger nonsense-mediated decay or to at least disrupt the C-terminal 95% of the protein product. The variant has been down-scored due to the consanguinity of the parents and the limitations of the genotyping method.

evidence.rdfs:label: Moore_2013_Patient_UCL-226_II:2
evidence.detectionMethod: DNA from the proband was subjected to DNA from the proband was subjected to Sanger sequencing of the ZMYND10 locus alone.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The patient has been noted to have motile cilia that are nearly immotile. Inner and outer dynein arm absence was complete.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: DNA from the proband was subjected to genotyping for ZMYND10 alone.

evidence.dc:description: NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.300del (p.Phe101Serfs38) is a frameshift variant in exon 3 of 12 and is predicted to trigger nonsense-mediated decay or at least to truncate ~77% of the protein product. The variant has been down-scored due to its homozygous state and the limitations of the genotyping method.

evidence.rdfs:label: Zariwala_2013_Patient_A5014_188_#278
evidence.detectionMethod: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone, and was performed by next-generation sequencing-based re-sequencing of the 12 exons of ZMYND10.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The individual has been diagnosed with PCD prior to genotyping. Other phenotypes that contributed to this diagnosis are not included in the report.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: Genotyping has been limited to the ZMYND10 locus alone.

evidence.dc:description: This variant has been up-scored for functional evidence of an impact on the gene product, but down-scored due to having previously been scored at the maximum level in a separate proband.

NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.47T>G (p.Val16Gly) is a missense variant that appears to be a hypomorphic allele, correlating with a milder / intermediate phenotype in the patient and similar ciliary motility defects in a *Drosophila* model. Rescue evidence indicates that it only partially rescues the sterility phenotype of the flies, relative to the wild-type.

NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.593_594del (p.Val198GlyfsTer13) is a frameshift variant in exon 6 of 12 and is predicted to trigger nonsense-mediated decay or to at least disrupt the C-terminal 55% of the protein product.

evidence.rdfs:label: Moore_2013_Patient_UCL-88_II:1
evidence.detectionMethod: DNA from the proband was subjected to whole-exome sequencing, followed by candidate gene Sanger resequencing.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The patient has been noted to have motile cilia that are nearly immotile. Inner and outer dynein arm loss was confirmed by immunofluorescent staining of cilia for DNAH5 and DNALI1.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: DNA from the proband was subjected to whole-exome sequencing.

evidence.dc:description: This variant has been up-scored for functional data but down-scored as it has already been reported for a different proband in a separate study (PMID: 23891471).

NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.47T>G (p.Val16Gly) is a missense variant that appears to be a hypomorphic allele, correlating with a milder / intermediate phenotype in the patient and similar ciliary motility defects in a Drosophila model. Rescue evidence indicates that it only partially rescues the sterility phenotype of the flies, relative to the wild-type (PMID: 23891471).
NM_015896.4(ZMYND10):c.300del (p.Phe101fs) is a frameshift variant in exon 3 of 12 and is predicted to trigger nonsense-mediated decay or at least to truncate ~77% of the protein product.

evidence.rdfs:label: Marshall_2015_Patient_120
evidence.detectionMethod: DNA from the proband was subjected to whole-exome sequencing, followed by candidate gene Sanger sequencing.
evidence.phenotypeFreeText: The patient has been diagnosed with primary ciliary dyskinesia.
evidence.previousTestingDescription: DNA from the proband was subjected to whole-exome sequencing. Prior to this, the patient had undergone Sanger sequencing of a panel of 12 PCD-linked genes.
